abstract: Judge Louis L Stanton of United States District Court in Manhattan rejects Justice Dept ruling on music licensing that would have upset longstanding rules governing royalties for songwriters and publishers; Justice Dept is reviewing order and may appeal.

keywords.value: American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers
keywords.name: organizations

lead_paragraph: Hailed by the music industry as a major victory, the judge’s decision says the Justice Department misinterpreted a regulatory document that governs the performing-rights agencies BMI and Ascap.
snippet: Hailed by the music industry as a major victory, the judge’s decision says the Justice Department misinterpreted a regulatory document that governs the performing-rights agencies BMI and Ascap....

headline.main: Judge Rejects Justice Department Ruling on Music Licensing
headline.print_headline: Judge Rejects Justice Dept. Decision on Music Licensing
